definition[0]: if someone fits in, they are accepted by the other people in a group
example[0]: I never really fitted in at school.
example[1]: I wasn’t sure if she would fit in with my friends.
definition[1]: to manage to do something or see someone, even though you have a lot of other things to do
example[2]: The doctor said he can fit me in at 4:30.
example[3]: I wanted to fit in a swim before breakfast.
definition[2]: if something fits in with other things, it is similar to them or goes well with them
example[4]: I don’t know quite how this new course will fit in.
example[5]: A new building must fit in with its surroundings.
example[6]: You can’t expect a baby to fit in with your existing routine.
